text: There were two Mules, so you'll walk. One was loaded with oats; the other was carrying the collection box. With this precious cargo swallowed up, he wanted nothing in the world to relieve him of it. He walked steady, making the waterfalls ring. In this, the enemy appears, and as what he was looking for was money, a platoon jumped on the mule, took him from the brake and stopped him. The animal, defending itself, was crippled, and the poor Gemini and sighed. - Is this what you promised me? The mule that followeth me escapeth danger; I fall upon him, and perish in him. "Friend", said the other, "it's not always a bargain to have a good job. If you had served a poor millman like me, you wouldn't be in such a hurry. FIN
title: Los dos mulos
author: Jean de La Fontaine
